story.storybody:
Summers and sweat go hand-in-hand. They can be nasty, embarrassing and stinky, and can even go up to the extent of killing your confidence right before you are ready to jump into a meeting or an interview.

But with so much heat, and the dreadful humid weather just around the corner, what can one possibly do--right? Wrong!

Also read: 5 easy ways to tackle smelly underarm sweat

People, here are 5 super-cool hacks you can befriend this summer to tackle sweat stains, whenever you want.

Also read: Do you sweat profusely? This is how you can control body odour

{funfacts}
  1. Wear a good-quality vest: Vest/undershirt or baniyaan (vest in Hindi) is probably what your mom made you wear all through childhood; and for good reason. A cotton vest keeps your pits and clothes dry and also keeps you fresh through the day.
  2. Use Argan oil: Using essential oils is one of the best ways to prevent sweat in the first place. Argan oil has been known to be a bit of a miracle solution. Apply a few drops on your underarms or below your breasts (if you have under-boob sweat problem) and you will no longer get sweaty, irritated by the heat, or those pesky marks.
  3. Waxing/shaving armpits regularly: Shaving armpits will keep the sweat from accumulating in by washing away all the bacteria. Also, cleaning and taking a bath regularly helps like nothing else.
  4. Panty liners: You can buy disposable underarm protectors or get a panty liner, which, unlike sanitary pads, are much thinner and soak sweat #likeaboss. You can cut a panty liner in half and stick it to the side of your dress. This is a good idea if you are heading to a dinner or party and wearing a synthetic-fabric dress.
  5. Talcum powder: This is the only go-to product that comes to mind when we think of stain rings. Although talcum powders soak sweat, they don't last long.
{funfacts}
